alert.note: Alert for East Polk; North Beltrami; North Clearwater; South Beltrami; South Clearwater (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 3:57AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Polk, central Beltrami and Clearwater Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 356 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northeastern White Earth Nation, or 27 miles west of Bemidji, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bagley around 400 AM CDT. Leonard and Weme around 410 AM CDT. Clearbrook and Gonvick around 415 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Berner and southwestern Lower Red Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: East Polk; North Beltrami; North Clearwater; South Beltrami; South Clearwater
